intro: Octomeria integrilabia, commonly known as the smooth-leaved octomeria, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves that are typically smooth and oval in shape. Its flowers are showy, with five petals and are often pink or white in color. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forest understories.
